abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column examines Texas Rangers World Series loss to St Louis Cardinals; holds that Game 6 was defining moment for the Rangers, asserting that they did not merely lose, they invented a new form of agony because in two separate innings they were one strike away from winning the title only to surrender the lead.
snippet: Game 6 was the defining moment for the Rangers. They didn’t just lose; they invented a new form of agony.
lead_paragraph: Game 6 was the defining moment for the Rangers. They didn’t just lose; they invented a new form of agony.

headline.main: For Texas, the Moment Slipped Away, Twice
headline.print_headline: For Texas, the Moment Slipped Away, Twice
headline.seo: The Rangers Invent a New Form of Agony
